com.github.git24j.core

Enum Diff.OptionFlag

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Diff.OptionFlag>
      • com.github.git24j.core.Diff.OptionFlag
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IBitEnum, Serializable, Comparable<Diff.OptionFlag>
    Enclosing class:
    Diff

    public static enum Diff.OptionFlag
extends Enum<Diff.OptionFlag>
implements IBitEnum

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      DISABLE_PATHSPEC_MATCH
      If the pathspec is set in the diff options, this flags indicates that the paths will be treated as literal paths instead of fnmatch patterns.
      ENABLE_FAST_UNTRACKED_DIRS
      When diff finds an untracked directory, to match the behavior of core Git, it scans the contents for IGNORED and UNTRACKED files.
      FORCE_BINARY
      Treat all files as binary, disabling text diffs
      FORCE_TEXT
      Treat all files as text, disabling binary attributes & detection
      IGNORE_CASE
      Use case insensitive filename comparisons
      IGNORE_FILEMODE
      Ignore file mode changes
      IGNORE_SUBMODULES
      Treat all submodules as unmodified
      IGNORE_WHITESPACE
      Ignore all whitespace
      IGNORE_WHITESPACE_CHANGE
      Ignore changes in amount of whitespace
      IGNORE_WHITESPACE_EOL
      Ignore whitespace at end of line
      INCLUDE_CASECHANGE
      May be combined with `GIT_DIFF_IGNORE_CASE` to specify that a file that has changed case will be returned as an add/delete pair.
      INCLUDE_IGNORED
      Include ignored files in the diff
      INCLUDE_TYPECHANGE
      Normally, a type change between files will be converted into a DELETED record for the old and an ADDED record for the new; this options enabled the generation of TYPECHANGE delta records.
      INCLUDE_TYPECHANGE_TREES
      Even with GIT_DIFF_INCLUDE_TYPECHANGE, blob->tree changes still generally show as a DELETED blob.
      INCLUDE_UNMODIFIED
      Include unmodified files in the diff
      INCLUDE_UNREADABLE
      Include unreadable files in the diff
      INCLUDE_UNREADABLE_AS_UNTRACKED
      Include unreadable files in the diff
      INCLUDE_UNTRACKED
      Include untracked files in the diff
      INDENT_HEURISTIC
      Use a heuristic that takes indentation and whitespace into account which generally can produce better diffs when dealing with ambiguous diff hunks.
      MINIMAL
      Take extra time to find minimal diff
      NORMAL0
      Normal diff, the default
      PATIENCE
      Use the "patience diff" algorithm
      RECURSE_IGNORED_DIRS
      Even with GIT_DIFF_INCLUDE_IGNORED, an entire ignored directory will be marked with only a single entry in the diff; this flag adds all files under the directory as IGNORED entries, too.
      RECURSE_UNTRACKED_DIRS
      Even with GIT_DIFF_INCLUDE_UNTRACKED, an entire untracked directory will be marked with only a single entry in the diff (a la what core Git does in `git status`); this flag adds *all* files under untracked directories as UNTRACKED entries, too.
      REVERSE
      Reverse the sides of the diff
      SHOW_BINARY
      Include the necessary deflate / delta information so that `git-apply` can apply given diff information to binary files.
      SHOW_UNMODIFIED
      When generating output, include the names of unmodified files if they are included in the git_diff.
      SHOW_UNTRACKED_CONTENT
      When generating patch text, include the content of untracked files.
      SKIP_BINARY_CHECK
      Disable updating of the `binary` flag in delta records.
      UPDATE_INDEX
      When diff finds a file in the working directory with stat information different from the index, but the OID ends up being the same, write the correct stat information into the index.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • NORMAL0

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag NORMAL0
        Normal diff, the default

      • REVERSE

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag REVERSE
        Reverse the sides of the diff

      • INCLUDE_IGNORED

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag INCLUDE_IGNORED
        Include ignored files in the diff

      • RECURSE_IGNORED_DIRS

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag RECURSE_IGNORED_DIRS
        Even with GIT_DIFF_INCLUDE_IGNORED, an entire ignored directory will be marked with only a single entry in the diff; this flag adds all files under the directory as IGNORED entries, too.

      • INCLUDE_UNTRACKED

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag INCLUDE_UNTRACKED
        Include untracked files in the diff

      • RECURSE_UNTRACKED_DIRS

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag RECURSE_UNTRACKED_DIRS
        Even with GIT_DIFF_INCLUDE_UNTRACKED, an entire untracked directory will be marked with only a single entry in the diff (a la what core Git does in `git status`); this flag adds *all* files under untracked directories as UNTRACKED entries, too.

      • INCLUDE_UNMODIFIED

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag INCLUDE_UNMODIFIED
        Include unmodified files in the diff

      • INCLUDE_TYPECHANGE

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag INCLUDE_TYPECHANGE
        Normally, a type change between files will be converted into a DELETED record for the old and an ADDED record for the new; this options enabled the generation of TYPECHANGE delta records.

      • INCLUDE_TYPECHANGE_TREES

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag INCLUDE_TYPECHANGE_TREES
        Even with GIT_DIFF_INCLUDE_TYPECHANGE, blob->tree changes still generally show as a DELETED blob. This flag tries to correctly label blob->tree transitions as TYPECHANGE records with new_file's mode set to tree. Note: the tree SHA will not be available.

      • IGNORE_FILEMODE

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag IGNORE_FILEMODE
        Ignore file mode changes

      • IGNORE_SUBMODULES

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag IGNORE_SUBMODULES
        Treat all submodules as unmodified

      • IGNORE_CASE

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag IGNORE_CASE
        Use case insensitive filename comparisons

      • INCLUDE_CASECHANGE

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag INCLUDE_CASECHANGE
        May be combined with `GIT_DIFF_IGNORE_CASE` to specify that a file that has changed case will be returned as an add/delete pair.

      • DISABLE_PATHSPEC_MATCH

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag DISABLE_PATHSPEC_MATCH
        If the pathspec is set in the diff options, this flags indicates that the paths will be treated as literal paths instead of fnmatch patterns. Each path in the list must either be a full path to a file or a directory. (A trailing slash indicates that the path will _only_ match a directory). If a directory is specified, all children will be included.

      • SKIP_BINARY_CHECK

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag SKIP_BINARY_CHECK
        Disable updating of the `binary` flag in delta records. This is useful when iterating over a diff if you don't need hunk and data callbacks and want to avoid having to load file completely.

      • ENABLE_FAST_UNTRACKED_DIRS

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag ENABLE_FAST_UNTRACKED_DIRS
        When diff finds an untracked directory, to match the behavior of core Git, it scans the contents for IGNORED and UNTRACKED files. If *all* contents are IGNORED, then the directory is IGNORED; if any contents are not IGNORED, then the directory is UNTRACKED. This is extra work that may not matter in many cases. This flag turns off that scan and immediately labels an untracked directory as UNTRACKED (changing the behavior to not match core Git).

      • UPDATE_INDEX

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag UPDATE_INDEX
        When diff finds a file in the working directory with stat information different from the index, but the OID ends up being the same, write the correct stat information into the index. Note: without this flag, diff will always leave the index untouched.

      • INCLUDE_UNREADABLE

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag INCLUDE_UNREADABLE
        Include unreadable files in the diff

      • INCLUDE_UNREADABLE_AS_UNTRACKED

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag INCLUDE_UNREADABLE_AS_UNTRACKED
        Include unreadable files in the diff

      • INDENT_HEURISTIC

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag INDENT_HEURISTIC
        Use a heuristic that takes indentation and whitespace into account which generally can produce better diffs when dealing with ambiguous diff hunks.

      • FORCE_TEXT

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag FORCE_TEXT
        Treat all files as text, disabling binary attributes & detection

      • FORCE_BINARY

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag FORCE_BINARY
        Treat all files as binary, disabling text diffs

      • IGNORE_WHITESPACE

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag IGNORE_WHITESPACE
        Ignore all whitespace

      • IGNORE_WHITESPACE_CHANGE

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag IGNORE_WHITESPACE_CHANGE
        Ignore changes in amount of whitespace

      • IGNORE_WHITESPACE_EOL

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag IGNORE_WHITESPACE_EOL
        Ignore whitespace at end of line

      • SHOW_UNTRACKED_CONTENT

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag SHOW_UNTRACKED_CONTENT
        When generating patch text, include the content of untracked files. This automatically turns on GIT_DIFF_INCLUDE_UNTRACKED but it does not turn on GIT_DIFF_RECURSE_UNTRACKED_DIRS. Add that flag if you want the content of every single UNTRACKED file.

      • SHOW_UNMODIFIED

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag SHOW_UNMODIFIED
        When generating output, include the names of unmodified files if they are included in the git_diff. Normally these are skipped in the formats that list files (e.g. name-only, name-status, raw). Even with this, these will not be included in patch format.

      • PATIENCE

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag PATIENCE
        Use the "patience diff" algorithm

      • MINIMAL

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag MINIMAL
        Take extra time to find minimal diff

      • SHOW_BINARY

        public static final Diff.OptionFlag SHOW_BINARY
        Include the necessary deflate / delta information so that `git-apply` can apply given diff information to binary files.

      • values

        public static Diff.OptionFlag[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (Diff.OptionFlag c : Diff.OptionFlag.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared
